function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Dismantling of partition walls may disrupt the containment of contagious diseases and facilitate their spread within the building.","Impact":"Increased risk of spreading contagious diseases among building occupants.","Mitigation":"Re-evaluate the design to incorporate effective containment measures for contagious diseases, such as partition walls or other barriers.","Technologies":"Use air purification systems and smart ventilation to control airflow and minimize the spread of contagious diseases.","People":"Building occupants, especially those in close proximity to the dismantled partitions.","Owner":"Architects, designers, and building management."},{"Description":"Workspace design may not consider physical distancing measures, leading to a higher risk of disease transmission among employees.","Impact":"Increased likelihood of disease transmission and contagion among employees in the office space.","Mitigation":"Reconfigure workstations to ensure adequate physical distancing and incorporate barriers or dividers to minimize direct contact between individuals.","Technologies":"Implement smart office layout tools and digital simulations to optimize workspace arrangements for physical distancing.","People":"Employees and office workers within the building.","Owner":"Designers, office management, and health and safety officials."},{"Description":"Refurbishment plans and changes in indoor climate may impact ventilation and air quality, potentially affecting disease transmission rates within the building.","Impact":"Disrupted airflow and ventilation systems may contribute to higher levels of disease transmission and reduced indoor air quality.","Mitigation":"Conduct thorough assessments of ventilation systems and air quality to ensure optimal circulation and filtration of indoor air. Implement ventilation upgrades and air quality monitoring systems as needed.","Technologies":"Utilize advanced HVAC systems, air quality sensors, and filtration technologies to optimize indoor air quality and minimize disease transmission risks.","People":"Building occupants, especially those sensitive to poor indoor air quality and respiratory conditions.","Owner":"Architects, HVAC specialists, and building maintenance teams."}]}
